title: openssl(3.0.2) issues / fedora (linux)
body:
Here are the logs:

```fish
Error: error:0308010C:digital envelope routines::unsupported
    at new Hash (node:internal/crypto/hash:67:19)
    at Object.createHash (node:crypto:130:10)
    at hash160 (/home/ryan/Desktop/learning/nft-collection-hardhat/epic-nfts/node_modules/ethereum-cryptography/vendor/hdkey-without-crypto.js:249:21)
    at HDKey.set (/home/ryan/Desktop/learning/nft-collection-hardhat/epic-nfts/node_modules/ethereum-cryptography/vendor/hdkey-without-crypto.js:50:24)
    at Function.HDKey.fromMasterSeed (/home/ryan/Desktop/learning/nft-collection-hardhat/epic-nfts/node_modules/ethereum-cryptography/vendor/hdkey-without-crypto.js:194:20)
    at deriveKeyFromMnemonicAndPath (/home/ryan/Desktop/learning/nft-collection-hardhat/epic-nfts/node_modules/hardhat/src/internal/util/keys-derivation.ts:22:27)
    at derivePrivateKeys (/home/ryan/Desktop/learning/nft-collection-hardhat/epic-nfts/node_modules/hardhat/src/internal/core/providers/util.ts:30:52)
    at normalizeHardhatNetworkAccountsConfig (/home/ryan/Desktop/learning/nft-collection-hardhat/epic-nfts/node_modules/hardhat/src/internal/core/providers/util.ts:58:10)
    at createProvider (/home/ryan/Desktop/learning/nft-collection-hardhat/epic-nfts/node_modules/hardhat/src/internal/core/providers/construction.ts:79:59)
    at /home/ryan/Desktop/learning/nft-collection-hardhat/epic-nfts/node_modules/hardhat/src/internal/core/runtime-environment.ts:80:28 {
  opensslErrorStack: [ 'error:03000086:digital envelope routines::initialization error' ],
  library: 'digital envelope routines',
  reason: 'unsupported',
  code: 'ERR_OSSL_EVP_UNSUPPORTED'
}
```
What i tried:

```fish
ryan@ghost ~/D/l/n/epic-nfts> rm -rf node_modules/
ryan@ghost ~/D/l/n/epic-nfts> ls
artifacts/  contracts/         package.json       README.md  test/
cache/      hardhat.config.js  package-lock.json  scripts/
ryan@ghost ~/D/l/n/epic-nfts> npm install
```

We use Linear to manage our development process, but we keep the conversations on Github.

LINEAR-ID: 69d388cb-3ea2-4145-a55a-cb234679c97b
I believe this is a duplicate of #1988, please re-open if you think that's not the case.

> I believe this is a duplicate of #1988, please re-open if you think that's not the case.

Awesome. It seems to be an issue with fedora specifically. Works like a charm on OpenSuse. Leave at closed.
(also its not related to the node version since i used node16)
